page.title: 19Leisure: Landwade Area
page.content: People spend between 10 and 20 hours a week on leisure activities. Most of this time is home based spent gardening, decorating, entertaining friends and watching television, almost always within the family or with one or two others. Some people are involved in local village activities - often Church based, or they travel to Cambridge (15 miles) and Bury St. Edmunds (12 miles) to use the facilities there: shops, cinema, theatre, sports centre and restaurants. They travel by car as there are few public transport sevices in the evenings. Newmarket (3 miles) provides a library, a swimming pool, some shops and{"The Cabaret Club"}with regular shows and dances as well as "Bingo" sessions.
